channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SWARM-545] Slow Startup Since 'Final' Release
item.description:
Google Groups Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/wildfly-swarm/ZF7SJoK1iJ0/R1ki6SwzCAAJ

Between BOM 1.0.0.CR1 and 1.0.0.Final the speed in which the application gets to:

11:05:39,631 INFO  [org.jboss.msc] (main) JBoss MSC version 1.2.6.Final

...in my project has significantly increased from 3 seconds to 4 minutes and the temp directory usage has increased from 54MB to 170MB.

I attempted to isolate the issue by using a simple project (POM attached) and the time went from 2 seconds to 7 seconds and 2MB to 4MB using CR1 and Final respectively.

Although faster it exhibits the same behaviour albeit at a smaller scale. When projects scale up it makes it unusable from an IDE as waiting minutes for startup is just not practice.
item.environment:
IDE: Eclipse Mars.2
Launch via org.wildfly.swarm.Swarm
Swarm Fractions: undertow, logging, webservices, spring, datasources

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
FYI, it appears to spend all it's time in:

Thread [main] (Suspended)	
	owns: FileDescriptor  (id=36)	
	FileOutputStream.close0() line: not available [native method]	
	FileOutputStream.access$000(FileOutputStream) line: 53	
	FileOutputStream$1.close() line: 356	
	FileDescriptor.closeAll(Closeable) line: 216	
	FileOutputStream.close() line: 354	
	BufferedOutputStream(FilterOutputStream).close() line: 159	
	IOUtil.copyWithClose(InputStream, OutputStream) line: 214	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate.processNode(ArchivePath, Node) line: 134	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 105	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).doExport() line: 95	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).export() line: 74	
	ExplodedExporterImpl.export(Archive<?>, File) line: 106	
	ExplodedExporterImpl.exportExploded(File, String) line: 90	
	ExplodedExporterImpl.exportExploded(File) line: 67	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate.processArchiveAsset(File, ArchiveAsset) line: 168	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate.processNode(ArchivePath, Node) line: 104	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 105	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).processNode(Node) line: 109	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).doExport() line: 95	
	ExplodedExporterDelegate(AbstractExporterDelegate<T>).export() line: 74	
	ExplodedExporterImpl.export(Archive<?>, File) line: 106	
	ExplodedExporterImpl.exportExploded(File, String) line: 90	
	ExplodedExporterImpl.exportExploded(File) line: 67	
	Swarm(Container).getDefaultDeploymentURL() line: 520	
	Swarm(Container).getDefaultDeploymentClassLoader() line: 531	
	Swarm(Container).setupXmlConfig() line: 364	
	Swarm(Container).start(boolean) line: 330	
	Swarm.start(boolean) line: 97	
	Swarm.start(boolean) line: 45	
	Swarm(Container).start() line: 324	
	Swarm.start() line: 107	
	Swarm.start() line: 45	
	Swarm.simpleMain(String...) line: 149	
	Swarm.main(String...) line: 141

Is it unpacking all the class files?!

At a first glance, I think your analysis looks right. Theres has been a change for SWARM-507, between core 1.0.0.CR3 and 1.0.0.Final, that introduces the around Swarm(Container).getDefaultDeploymentURL() .

It unpacks deployment contents, which would also explain the tmp file usage and increased boot time in relation to increased application contents. But I would need to take a close look first, to confirm it.
I've just tried BOM 1.0.0.CR2 which also exhibits the same behaviour.
Dan Siviter I think I don't full understand your comment. So you are saying that there is no difference between CR1/CR2 compared to Final?

Apologies, I should have put a little more context. Using the BOM:

  • CR1 - Startup time is fast,
  • CR2 & Final - Startup time is poor.
Good, in that case i baseline the tests on cr1
The jprofiler hotspot analysis confirms what Dan Siviter did report
Waiting on SWARM-565 for the final verification

Dan Siviter According to my tests, this is resolved. But maybe you want to give it a try as well? It is included in the current master (org.wildfly.swarm:wildfly-swarm:2016.7-SNAPSHOT). If you want to try that version, please note that bom GAV has changed. It would be "or.wildfly.swarm:bom-all" now.

Doesn't matter, I've found it.

Yea, looks much quicker, around a second for a project with undertow and cdi fractions.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Reproducible every time.

  1. Create project using attached POM,
  2. Run project using org.wildfly.swarm.Swarm and BOM 1.0.0.CR1 and 1.0.0.Final,
  3. Observe difference in startup between the versions.
